intro: Alsodeia rubra, commonly known as the red alsike, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its bright red flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Alsodeia rubra is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
